intro: Rhyncholacis penicillata, commonly known as the slender thornapple, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and clusters of small, white or pink flowers. Its fruit is a follicle that splits open to release seeds, and it often grows in disturbed soils or along roadsides. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
